sources.title: Rainbow Island (1917) Directed By Billy Gilbert
sources.description: Rainbow Island Directed by Billy Gilbert Written by H.M. Walker Produced by Hal Roach Starring Harold Lloyd Cinematography Walter Lundin Edited by Della Mullady Release date October 28, 1917 Country United States Language Silent with English intertitles Rainbow Island is a 1917 American short comedy film featuring Harold Lloyd . [ 1 ] Plot While fishing in a rowboat, Harold and Snub find a message in a bottle. The paper contains a map of Rainbow Island with an X indicating buried treasure. When they row to the island in search of the treasure, they are quickly captured by a tribe of cannibals. Cast Harold Lloyd Snub Pollard Bebe Daniels Frank Alexander Carl Barbesgaard William Blaisdell Sammy Brooks Walter Crompton Billy Evans Billy Fay (as William Fay) Max Hamburger Oscar Larson Gus Leonard Belle Mitchell Fred C. Newmeyer Hazel Powell Hazel Redmond Gertrude Smith Nina Speight References "Progressive Silent Film List: Rainbow Island" . Silent Era . Retrieved December 13, 2008 .

metadata.Plot: After finding a note in a floating bottle, our hero is off to resue the heroine. He runs into a tribe of cannibals.
